oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Court records from Confederate depredations in Morgan County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Documents submitted in an wartime property damages case between Lewis H. Mosier and William L. Schooler et. al. adjudicated in Morgan County Chancery Court. Complainant maintains that defendents owe him $150 for burning his barn and taking items such as milk cows, blankets, bushels of corn, horses, and more. Defendents have left the countryside and fled the state. Part of a series of postwar litigation in Morgan County seeking damages suffered by loyal Unionists at the hands of Confederate partisans.
